name: Buttons (Design-First)
description: Visually distinct button designs focused on aesthetics, depth, lighting, and surface treatment

name: Hover Interactions
description: Hover effects that can be applied to any UI element — buttons, cards, images, links, list items

name: Active / Press Interactions
description: Visual feedback patterns that occur when an element is pressed, clicked, or tapped

name: Loading States
description: Patterns that visually communicate waiting, processing, or background work

name: Success & Error Feedback
description: Patterns that visually communicate outcomes — whether an action succeeded or failed

name: Cards (Design-First)
description: Gallery of card designs used to group content, actions, or data

name: Forms & Inputs
description: Patterns focused on user input clarity, validation, and feedback

name: Navigation Interactions
description: Patterns that guide users through an interface and help them understand location

name: Modals, Drawers & Overlays
description: Patterns for layered UI elements that temporarily sit above the main interface

name: Glass & Blur Effects
description: Glassmorphism, frosted UI, blur-based interaction patterns
